qas.question: Where do the majority of renewable energies derive their energy from?
What is one way that characterizes solar technologies as passive or active?

answers.text: depending on the way they capture, convert and distribute sunlight

qas.question: Which renewable energies do not acquire their energy from the sun?
How do renewable energies acquire energy from the sun?

context: Solar technologies are broadly characterized as either <a1_0>passive or active<a1_0/> <a2_0>depending on the way they capture, convert and distribute sunlight<a2_0/> and enable solar energy to be harnessed at different levels around the world, mostly depending on distance from the equator. Although solar energy refers primarily to the use of solar radiation for practical ends, all renewable energies, other than <a3_0>geothermal and tidal<a3_0/>, derive their energy from <a0_0>the Sun<a0_0/> in a <a4_0>direct or indirect<a4_0/> way.
